page.title: 02HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: ST MARY'S CHURCH was built in 1080 making it about 905 years old.The village originates from Saxon Times and after the building of the church, the village grew up to be as big as it is today.The oldest house is Addington House.It was built in the 1500's.The village was built around the house which was then inhabited by serfs.The original part is still preserved but there are many additions.The third palace,which still exists today was built in 1770.An Archbishop of Canterbury bought the palace to live in.After the 6th Archbishop the palace was sold to a rich diamond merchant.He added many parts to the building.In 1954 the royal school of church music moved in and still use the palace today.
